div.h2: WELCOME TO BROOKFIELD R-III SCHOOL DISTRICT

strong.a: Brookfield R-III Elementary and Middle School Blood Drive Information

blockquote.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

strong.span: SUMMER JOURNEY 2020 – Enroll by May 1st! No late enrollments accepted!
Marceline R-V Schools is kicking off enrollment for Summer Journey 2020 with on-line registration!

p.span: Although schools are currently closed due to COVID-19, we are hopeful that we will still be able to host summer school for students in our area. At this time we are planning to begin summer school on the original date of May 18 and conclude on June 19. These dates are TENTATIVE and may be adjusted based on the safety of our students and staff. We feel it is best to be proactive and begin the enrollment process so that we can have everything ready to go for Summer Journey. Parents should be aware that there is a likelihood that Summer Journey may be canceled and not held this summer. Please plan to enroll your child if you would like them to attend. You will be placed on a text messaging list and updates will be provided through our Marceline R-V Schools Facebook page as well as the #SummerJourney 2020 text group. We look forward to having your child at Summer Journey 2020!

p.strong:
The enrollment deadline is May 1st! Please complete the online registration form today!
Enrollment Link: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/MarcelineSJ

strong.a: Public Schools to Stay Closed the Remainder of the School Year Letter from Dr. Collins ~ 04/10/2020

span.a: Continued Closure Letter from Dr. Collins ~ 04/02/2020

strong.a: Important Message in Regards to the School Closure - Letter from Dr. Collins

span.span: If you as a parent/guardian are concerned about your child's mental health in response to the current circumstances, please complete the questions in the survey and a member of our counseling staff will be in contact.

span.style: font-size: 22px; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.span: Due to the current situation of our country, we will not be holding our pre bid meeting as scheduled. We will however, be holding on site visits by scheduled appointments. Any bid submitted by a contractor without a scheduled appointment will be rejected. To schedule an onsite visit, contractors must communicate by email, with Matt Parn, at

a.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.span: . Appointments must be scheduled by Thursday, March 26, at 3:00 PM. Contractors may schedule visits for the days of March 25th-March 31, 8:00 AM-4:00 PM. Any questions asked at the time of the onsite visit will be documented and answered on April 9th by email.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

strong.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: "arial narrow", sans-serif; font-size: small;

strong.strong: The Brookfield R-III School District will sell the following four surplus items at a silent auction: edge trimmer, weed trimmer, and two pianos. Items may be viewed and bid on MONDAY, MARCH 23, 2020 THROUGH MONDAY, MARCH 30, 2020, from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. in the Central Office located at 124A Pershing Road, Brookfield, Missouri. Bids will be opened on WEDNESDAY, APRIL 1, 2020, at 1:30 P.M. and successful bidders will be notified as soon as possible. Items will need to be picked up and paid for by Friday, April 17, 2020, at 2 p.m.

div.p: The Brookfield R-III School District Board of Education is committed to maintaining a workplace and educational environment that is free from discrimination and harassment in admission or access to, or treatment or employment in, its programs, services, activities and facilities. In accordance with law, the district strictly prohibits discrimination and harassment against employees, students or others on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law. The Brookfield R-III School District is an equal opportunity employer. For full policy click here
